alert.note: Alert for Geary; Pottawatomie; Riley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kansas and northeast Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Kansas, Geary. In northeast Kansas, Pottawatomie and Riley. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Manhattan, Junction City, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, St. George and Keats.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
